incidents.name: Messaging-api-5xx-caused-by-sms

incident_updates.body: Twilio Programmable Messaging API was degraded for 5 minutes on May 3rd between 17:00 and 17:05 PST. During this period of time, customers may have received 5xx's in API responses for SMS messages. This issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Change in How Super SIM Data Usage is Reported for Some Queries to the UsageRecords API

incident_updates.body:
We have determined that we will not be able to revert the unannounced change in API behavior without the underlying usage reporting services becoming degraded, resulting in other queries also failing. We have sent out a detailed email to recent users of the Super SIM UsageRecords API with additional details. We will be updating the UsageRecords API documentation to reflect the new behavior.
We suggest you consider changing all queries to this API for periods greater than 24 hours to use timestamps that fall on UTC hour boundaries to ensure you get accurate and consistent results for your requested start and end  times. You may need to rerun reports or adjust amounts persisted to your own systems if you recorded excessive data usage due this unannounced change in API behavior. We apologize for any inconvenience that this causes you

Our engineering teams are continuing to discuss options for restoring the impacted functionality while maintaining stability in the underlying usage reporting services. We will provide another update on Wednesday, 5/01. In the meantime, it is suggested that if possible, you consider modifying usage queries for periods over 24 hours to use timestamps that fall on UTC hour boundaries to ensure that you get accurate results in case this functionality cannot be restored.

Our engineering teams are continuing to discuss options for restoring the impacted functionality while maintaining stability in the underlying usage reporting services. We will provide another update on Tuesday, 4/30. In the meantime, it is suggested that if possible, you consider modifying usage queries for periods over 24 hours to use timestamps that fall on UTC hour boundaries to ensure that you get accurate results in case this functionality cannot be restored.

Our engineering teams are continuing to discuss options for restoring the impacted functionality while maintaining stability in the underlying usage reporting services. We will provide another update on Monday, 4/29. In the meantime, it is suggested that if possible, you consider modifying usage queries for periods over 24 hours to use timestamps that fall on UTC hour boundaries to ensure that you get accurate results in case this functionality cannot be restored."

Beginning ~18:48 UTC today, when querying data usage for an individual SIM for a range greater than 1 day, instead of returning exact results for that range, data for the entirety of the first and last UTC hour are being included in the results. This can result in the amount being reported being higher than expected. For example, if you query usage for a single SIM from 2024-04-24 12:10 UTC - 2024-04-25 14:30 UTC you will get the same results as if you asked for 2024-04-24 12:00 -  2024-04-25 15:00 UTC. Queries with a range of 1 day (24 hours) or less for a SIM will still return results just for that range.
This behavior is different than the documented API behavior and what the API previously returned. Prior to 18:48 UTC, when querying data usage for a single SIM, you could provide start and end times that did not fall on a UTC hour and you would get partial hour results for the first and last hours. Now, usage for the entire first and last hour are being included, returning more usage than previously. Again, the results for periods of 24 hours or less continue to return correct, partial hour results.
This change was implemented due to unexpected performance issues with the underlying usage reporting system. We are investigating these issues to determine if we can restore this previous functionality. We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super Sim. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS, Middle East & Africa

incidents.name: Voice Intelligence Transcripts Missing Call Details Metadata

incident_updates.body: Voice Intelligence Transcripts call details metadata was degraded for 2 hours between 14:31 and 16:31 Pacific Time on 04/29/2024. During this period of time, customers may have created transcriptions without call details (call from and call to number). All other attributes are present and correct. No delay in producing the transcripts. The issue has now been resolved.
Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with Voice Intelligence Transcripts. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

incidents.name: 500 Errors for API Requests

incident_updates.body: 500 error for API request has been resolved and API is operating normally at this time.

API requests for Identity, Lookup, Serverless, Video, Voice, Conversations & Sync, Messaging, IoT, Verify, Studio, Event Streams and Flex are now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating an elevated rate of 500 errors for Multiple API requests. Our engineers are working on the issue, and we will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with API responses. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Event Streams Delivery Delays

incident_updates.body: Delays with Event Streams has been resolved and it is operating normally at this time.
Event Streams are now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Replay of impacted events between 06:25 and 06:56 Pacific Time succeeded. The replay was done between 08:00 and 08:15 Pacific Time. We will continue monitoring and provide an update in 30 minutes.

This incident causing Event Streams delays was prematurely resolved in one of our previous posts. Please refer to https://status.twilio.com/incidents/gp78s043d2p7 for previous updates. On-call engineers will start replaying all events between events are flowing correctly. We will continue to monitor for system stability and works towards delivery of the events between 06:25 and 06:56 Pacific Time. All customers subscribed to any events that happened during that period will receive the events starting now. This remediates the incident and protects the at-least-once delivery guarantees that Event Streams promises. Our next update will be provided in 30 minutes. We apologize for the inconvenience and for any confusion this may have caused.

incidents.name: Failure of Outbound MMS With Twilio Hosted Media

incident_updates.body: Outbound MMS flow with Twilio hosted media was degraded for 23 days, 4 hours and 15 minutes between 00:45 Pacific Time on 04/01/2024 and 17:00 Pacific Time on 04/24/2024. During this period of time, customers may have experienced failures for outbound MMS with Twilio hosted media. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Event Streams Delivery Delays

incident_updates.body: This incident related to Event Streams delays was resolved prematurely. Please refer to https://status.twilio.com/incidents/tsqjgwg3hb89 for further updates. We apologize for the inconvenience and for any confusion this may have caused.

We’ve identified an issue affecting the delivery of some events through Event Streams, specifically between 06:25 and 06:56 Pacific Time. Our engineering team has mitigated the issue and new events are flowing correctly. We will continue to monitor for system stability and works towards delivery of the events between 06:25 and 06:56 Pacific Time. We’ll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Event streams delivery. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to RighTel Network in Iran

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to RighTel Network in Iran. This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Delayed Call Record Availability

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing delayed call record availability issues.  This incident has been resolved.

We are observing recovery from the issue causing delayed availability for call records and Voice Intelligence transcript metadata. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to investigate the issue causing delays in call record availability via both the console and REST API. Calls themselves are unaffected. This incident also impacts customers' ability to view a subset of participant metadata in Voice Intelligence transcriptions for Twilio Recordings. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are investigating delays in call record availability via both the console and REST API. Calls themselves are unaffected.  We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue that may affect availability of call records after call completion. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.
